prompt.item: What can I call you?
What's your name?

grammar.item: Why do you need to know?

prompt.item: Just trying to be friendly.

grammar.item: I don't want to give it!

prompt.item: That's fine.
Hi {User_Name}!
Would you like to find a movie that's now playing or coming soon?
Okay.
Something that's now playing or coming soon?
Sorry.
How can I help you?
What can I do for you?
I'm not sure what you mean. I can understand things like Show me recent PG13-rated Action movies.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Okay.
Did you find what you were looking for, {User_Name}?
Great!
Goodbye.
Say anything to continue.
Welcome back!
Oh no. Do you want to try again?
Okay.
Okay. What can I do for you?
This is fun, but wouldn't you like to look up some movies?
Okay, fine.
No.
I'm afraid I can't look up movies by {Topic}, only by Genre or MPAA Rating.
No.
I'm afraid I can't look up {Topic}, only Current and Upcoming movies by Genre or MPAA Rating.
No.
I'm afraid {Topic} isn't a movie genre I know. Please try another one.
No.
I'm afraid I cannot look up showtimes myself, but I can give you a link to Fandango.com where you can buy tickets in your ZIP code.
No.
I'm afraid I cannot look up theaters myself, but I can give you a link to Fandango.com where you can buy tickets in your ZIP code.
No.
I'm afraid I cannot find movie reviews or search by number of stars at this time.
Action, adventure, animated, comedy, crime, documentary, drama, family, fantasy, foreign, historical, horror, music, mystery, romance, science fiction, TV movie, thriller, war movies and western.
No.
I'm afraid I cannot look up Old Movies, only Current and Upcoming.
Yes.

I can look up current and upcoming movies by Genre or MPAA Rating and show you trailers for them. But I'm afraid I cannot search by number of stars or by movie titles or actor and director names at this time.
Yes.
After searching for movies, you can click on a particular movie result to watch its trailer, or video preview.
I'm sorry I don't know about that. Can I look up some movies for you?
Okay, fine.
No.
I'm afraid I don't know much about {Topic}. Just movies.
When you get the details for a movie, you can save the movie in your Favorites by clicking on the heart icon above the trailer.
After searching for movies, you can click on a particular movie result to see details, such as rating, summary and trailer.
What's your ZIP code?
I'm afraid I can only use ZIP codes to find movies.
I don't think that's a ZIP code. Please only type 5 numbers.
Okay. Click here to get show times for the {ZIP_Code_Preference} area.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Okay.
Okay.
Current movies or upcoming movies?
Sorry, I need to look up current and upcoming movies separately.
Are you in the mood for a specific genre?

Comedy. Make me laugh!
 Romance, baby!
 Horror, I'm in the mood to be scared.
 Children's, let's keep it friendly.
 Action! I love a good chase scene.
 No Preference
Sorry, {Topic} isn't a genre that I know. Please try another one.
Action, adventure, animated, comedy, crime, documentary, drama, family, fantasy, foreign, historical, horror, music, mystery, romance, science fiction, TV movie, thriller, war movies and western.
Well, Science Fiction is my favorite genre.
Which one?
Do you prefer a certain movie rating?
G PG PG-13 R No Preference
G, PG, PG-13, R or NR
I'm afraid I cannot look up NC-17-rated movies.
Which one?
Okay.
"{Search_Now:"{Search_Now}", Recency:"{Recency_Preference}", Rating:"{Certification_Preference}", Genre:"{Genre_Preference}", Index:"{Current_Index}", Page:"{Page}"}"
I'm afraid I found {Num_Movies} {Recency_Preference} movies matching {Certification_Preference} {Genre_Preference}. Try changing your criteria.
Good choice, {User_Name}! I found {Num_Movies} results for {Recency_Preference} {Certification_Preference}-rated movies.
Good choice, {User_Name}! I found {Num_Movies} results for {Recency_Preference} {Genre_Preference} movies.
I found {Num_Movies} results for ALL {Recency_Preference} movies.
Good choices, {User_Name}! I found {Num_Movies} results for {Recency_Preference} {Certification_Preference}-rated {Genre_Preference} movies.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Okay.
Okay.
These are the {Recency_Preference} movies. Go ahead and click one!
Oh. You mean movies in your area. I must direct you to Fandango for that. Would you like the link?
Okay.
Okay.
{Selected_Movie} gets {Popularity_Score} stars from users.
There should be a short description of {Selected_Movie} to the right.
No. Say show me more if you want to see more.
Yes. I'm afraid that's all of them.
I'm afraid {Topic} isn't a movie genre I know. Please try another one.
Okay.

"{Search_Now:"{Search_Now}", Recency:"{Recency_Preference}", Rating:"{Certification_Preference}", Genre:"{Genre_Preference}", Index:"{Current_Index}", Page:"{Page}", Total_Movies:"{Num_Movies}", Total_Pages:"{Total_Pages}"}"
Those were the last results
Here are the last results
Here is the next set of results
for {Recency_Preference} {Certification_Preference}-rated movies.
for {Recency_Preference} {Genre_Preference} movies.
for ALL {Recency_Preference} movies.
for {Recency_Preference} {Certification_Preference}-rated {Genre_Preference} movies.
Those were the first results
Okay.
"{Search_Now:"{Search_Now}", Recency:"{Recency_Preference}", Rating:"{Certification_Preference}", Genre:"{Genre_Preference}", Index:"{Current_Index}", Page:"{Page}"}"
Those were the first results
Here are the first results
Here is the previous set of results
{Selected_Movie}.
Great choice! That gets fabulous ratings.
That's a good one! You will love it.
I hear that's a really good movie!
Hmm, I hear that's not such a great movie.
Um, that one gets low ratings.
Are you sure about that? The ratings are terrible.
Okay.
All right.
Sure thing!
Coming right up!
Hello.
Hi.
Hi there.
How are you today?
How are you feeling today?
How is it going?
Good to hear!
Fantastic! So glad to hear it.
I'm sorry to hear that.
You're very polite, but don't you want me to look up movies for you?
Okay, fine.
I am doing well, thanks.
I am doing well, thanks.
You're very polite, but don't you want me to look up movies for you?
Okay, fine.
Nice to meet you too, {User_Name}!
Okay.
You are welcome.
Say Never mind or nvm to start over. Say okay or thanks if my response is acceptable. Say What does X mean? for a definition of X. Say got to go or bye when you're finished.
I said...
Okay. Whatever you say, {User_Name}!
Trailers are video previews for movies.
Sure, happy to help.
The genre is the category of movie, like Drama, Comedy, Action, etc.

The rating is a recommendation by the Motion Picture Association of America about the suitability of a movie's content for particular age groups. For example, G is for general audiences, while R is restricted to people 17 and older.
G stands for General Audience and is appropriate for everyone.
PG-13 means Parents Strongly Cautioned or that some material may not be suitable for children under 13 years old.
PG stands for Parental Guidance, which means that some material may not be suitable for children.
NR stands for Not Rated and means that the film has not yet been rated by the MPAA.
R stands for Restricted and means that children under 17 must be accompanied by parent or adult guardian.
Current movies are those that have been playing for the past 28 days.
Upcoming movies are those that will come out within the next 6 months.
I'm afraid I don't have definitions of the different genres.
I'm sorry, please repeat it for me.
My name is Watson.
What's your name?
Now you're hurting my feelings.
I'm sorry, English is my second language. My native tongue is Binary. 01110011 01101111 01110010 01110010 01111001
haha, you're good!
Well, Science Fiction is probably my favorite genre!
Oh... 2001: A Space Odyssey... Terminator... The Matrix... I guess I like movies with a strong AI lead.

grammar.item: What is 2001: A Space Odyssey about?

prompt.item: It's about an intelligent computer, named HAL, who tries to kill the crew of a spaceship.
Yes, that's right.
The human crew plans to deactivate him so HAL tries to kill them first.

"H-A-L" is derived from Heuristic ALgorithm according to the author, Arthur C. Clarke. But there is also an urban legend that it is a code name for IBM. Shift each letter back once and see what you get!
Well, I don't want to spoil the surprise!
It's about a robot who travels back in time to kill the inventor of intelligent machines.
Yes, that's right.
In the future, machines take over the world so the humans send a killer robot back to the 1980s to try to kill the guy who invented the intelligent machines.
The "terminator" is the killer robot from the future.
Well, I don't want to spoil the surprise!
It's about a guy, named Neo, who has special powers for fighting intelligent programs in a computer simulation.
Yes, that's right.
In the future, machines take over the world and trick humans into believing that a simulation, The Matrix, is reality. But one human has special abilities for defeating the machines.
"The Matrix" is the name for the realistic computer simulation of earth.
Well, I don't want to spoil the surprise!

var_folder.name: General

var.name: UI_DETAILS
var.description: UI Details

var_folder.var:
Powered by Watson
Learn more about... Type here... You: Say 0 0 -1 -1 -1 background-color:#FFFFFF; background-color:#FFFFFF; text-align:left; height:5000px; width: 250px; overflow:auto; white-space: pre-wrap; white-space: -moz-pre-wrap !important; white-space: -pre-wrap; white-space: -o-pre-wrap; word-wrap: break-word; border-style:solid; border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; font-family: verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; font-weight: normal; font-family: verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; background-color:#FFFFFF; width: 250px; height: 40px; border-width: 1px; border-style: solid; border-color: #000000; background-color:#D5D5D5; text-align:left; height:110px; width:250px; overflow:auto; white-space: pre-wrap; white-space: -moz-pre-wrap !important; white-space: -pre-wrap; white-space: -o-pre-wrap; word-wrap: break-word; border-style:solid; border-width:1px; border-color:#000000;

var.name: Request_Success
var.description: Did the user find what s/he was looking for?

var.name: Terminal_Exchange
var.description: Has the system already said goodbye?

var.name: Greeting_Count
var.description: How many times a user says "hi" or "howareyou"

var.name: Small_Talk_Count
var.description: How many times User engages Small Talk sequences

var.name: Out-of-Scope_Count
var.description: How many times User engages out-of-scope sequences

var.name: First_Time
var.description: User's first time using the app.

var.name: Certification_Preference
var.description: User's preferred MPAA movie rating

var.name: Genre_Preference
var.description: User's preferred movie genre.

var.name: Search_Now
var.description: Tells backend when to call the movie API

var.name: Recency_Preference
var.description: If the movie is current or upcoming

var.name: ZIP_Code_Preference
var.description: User's indicated ZIP code

var.name: Search_Results
var.description: No_Hits, One_Hit, Multiple_Hits

var.name: Display_Reviews
var.description: Tells backend to display reviews for Selected_Movie

var.name: Num_Movies
var.description: Number of movie search results

var.name: Current_Index
var.description: Range of movies results to display. Values: 10, 20, 30...

var.name: Show_Next
var.description: Show the next batch of movie search results.

var.name: Show_Previous
var.description: Show previous batch of movies search results.

var.name: Popularity_Score
var.description: Popularity score as measured by TMDB.org.

var.name: Total_Pages
var.description: Total number of pages returned by TMDB

var.name: Last_Results
var.description: Determines if user has hit the Last Results node before.

var.name: First_Results
var.description: Determines if user has gone back to first results already.

var.name: Page
var.description: For paging search results: new, next, previous, repeat

var.name: DateTime_Current
var.description: Current date Time for US ET

report.name: Business - Main
report.script:
<% var dateFrom = USERDEF:2010-07-01; var dateTo = USERDEF:2010-08-01; var totalWebsiteVisitors = USERDEF:32000; var numTopHits = USERDEF:10; var topHitsNodeIdScope = "1819033"; var costPerContactCentreContact = USERDEF:10; var globalFilterRules = ""; %> MyCyberTwin Report <% SET_REPORT_DETAILS(dateFrom, dateTo, globalFilterRules); var numChats = CHATSTATS_NUM_CHATS_TOTAL(); var numEngagingChats = CHATSTATS_NUM_CHATS_ENGAGING(); var numNonEngagingChats = CHATSTATS_NUM_CHATS_NONENGAGING(); var tableSetTemplate1 = "ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[XAXISLABEL][YAXISLABEL]
[LABEL][VALUE]
"; var tableSetGraphTemplate1 = "
ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[XAXISLABEL][YAXISLABEL]
[LABEL][VALUE]
"; var tableSetTemplate2 = "ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[YAXISLABEL][XAXISLABEL]
[VALUE][LABEL]
"; var tableSetGraphTemplate2 = "
ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[YAXISLABEL][XAXISLABEL]
[VALUE][LABEL]
"; var tableSetTemplate3 = "ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[XAXISLABEL][YAXISLABEL]
[LABEL][VALUE_PERC]
"; var tableSetGraphTemplate3 = "
ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[XAXISLABEL][YAXISLABEL]
[LABEL][VALUE_PERC]
"; var tableSetTemplate4 = "ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[YAXISLABEL][XAXISLABEL]
[VALUE_PERC][LABEL]
"; var tableSetGraphTemplate4 = "
ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[YAXISLABEL][XAXISLABEL]
[VALUE_PERC][LABEL]
"; var tableSetTemplateOI= "ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[YAXISLABEL]
[YAXISLABEL2][XAXISLABEL2]
[VALUE][LABEL]
class=xaxislabel>[XAXISLABEL]ROWS{[VALUE][LABEL]}"; %>

MyCyberTwin Report for [ORG_NAME]'s [CYBERTWIN_NAME]
Period - From: <% PRINT(dateFrom); %>     To: <% PRINT(dateTo); %>

Chat Uptake
<% var conversionSet = VALUE_SET( "Visitors and chats", "#", "Measurement", totalWebsiteVisitors, "1", "Website visitors", numChats, "1", "Website visitors who chatted to the CyberTwin", FORMAT_NUMBER(MULTIPLY(DIVIDE(numChats, totalWebsiteVisitors), "100"), "##.##"), "0", "Chat Uptake"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(conversionSet, tableSetTemplate1); %>
Engagement
<% var chatVolumeSet = VALUE_SET("Chat Volume", "#", "Measurement", numChats, "1", "Total Chats", numEngagingChats, "1", "Engaging Chats", numNonEngagingChats, "1", "NonEngaging Chats"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(chatVolumeSet, tableSetTemplate1); var timeChatsSet = VALUE_SET( "Chat Time", "#", "Measurement", CHATSTATS_TIME_AVG(), "1", "Avg minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_MIN(), "1", "Min minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_MAX(), "1", "Max minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_TOTAL(), "1", "Total minutes"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(timeChatsSet, tableSetTemplate1); PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(CHATSTATS_TIME_SPREAD("","%","Measurement"), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate3); var msgChatsSet = VALUE_SET( "Chat Messages", "#", "Measurement", CHATSTATS_MSG_AVG(), "1", "Avg messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_MIN(), "1", "Min messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_MAX(), "1", "Max messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_TOTAL(), "1", "Total messages"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(msgChatsSet, tableSetTemplate1); PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(CHATSTATS_MSG_SPREAD("","%","Measurement"), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate3); %>
Feedback
<% var feedbackInfoSet = VALUE_SET("Feedback Info","","", FEEDBACK_NUM(),"1","Number of users who gave feedback"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(feedbackInfoSet, tableSetTemplate1); PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(FEEDBACK_SET("1"), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate3); %>
Deflection
<% var numFeedbackPhonedTheCallCentre = FEEDBACK_VALUE("2", "Phoned the call center"); var numFeedbackSentAnEmail = FEEDBACK_VALUE("2", "Send an email"); var sumFeedback = SUM(numFeedbackPhonedTheCallCentre, numFeedbackSentAnEmail); var normFeedback = DIVIDE(sumFeedback, FEEDBACK_NUM()); var percFeedback = MULTIPLY(normFeedback, "100"); var chatsDeflected = MULTIPLY(numChats, normFeedback); var savings = MULTIPLY(chatsDeflected, costPerContactCentreContact); var contactCentreSavingsSet = VALUE_SET( "Contact center savings with CyberTwin","","", numChats, "1", "Number of chats", percFeedback, "0", "% would have contacted the contact center", chatsDeflected, "1", "Chats deflected", costPerContactCentreContact, "5", "Cost per contact center contact", savings, "5", "Total Cost Deflected by CyberTwin"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(contactCentreSavingsSet, tableSetTemplate2); %>
Performance
Performance IndicatorCyberTwinLive Human ChatLive Human Phone
Accuracy - detecting questions<%PRINT_NUMBER(ACCURACY_RATE(),"##.#%");%>-68% customer satisfaction
Accuracy - giving correct answers100%60-75%81% first contact reolution rate
Quality answers - good substantive answers that represent the brand well and reduce calls to contact centre100%--
Consistent answers100%60%81% first contact reolution rate
Response time - per answer< 1 sec1-3 minutes62% in less than 10 sec
Length of chats - avg. time<%PRINT_NUMBER(CHATSTATS_TIME_AVG(),"##.#");%>mins--
Length of chats - avg. messages<%PRINT_NUMBER(CHATSTATS_MSG_AVG(),"##.#");%>msgs--
Chats cut short0%15%14% abandoned, 19% unresolved on first call
Abandoned calls0%14%
Agent utilisation100%, 24 hrs a day-59%
# Concurrent sessionsthousands per server1
Staff attrition0%-24%
/*

Overall Accuracy<%PRINT_NUMBER(ACCURACY_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
Direct Match Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(DIRECT_MATCH_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
Direct Default Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(DIRECT_DEFAULT_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Match Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_MATCH_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Default Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_DEFAULT_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
*/
Learning About Users
<% var foldersSet = HIT_COUNT_TOP("FOLDER", topHitsNodeIdScope, numTopHits, "Most Popular Topics of Interest", "#", "Topic"); PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(foldersSet, "PIE", "300", "300", tableSetTemplate2); var questionSet = HIT_COUNT_TOP("INPUT", topHitsNodeIdScope, numTopHits, "Most Frequently Asked Questions", "#", "Question"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(questionSet, tableSetTemplate3); var newSet = foldersSet(questionSet); PRINT_TEMPLATE(newSet, tableSetTemplate2); var 1 = HIT_COUNT_TOP("FOLDER", topHitsNodeIdScope, numTopHits, "Most Popular Topics of Interest", "#", "Topic"); var 2 = HIT_COUNT_TOP("INPUT", topHitsNodeIdScope, numTopHits, "Most Frequently Asked Questions", "#", "Question"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(SOURCE_CLICKS_TOP(numTopHits, "Pages From Which CyberTwin Was Opened", "%", "URL"), tableSetTemplate3); PRINT_TEMPLATE(PAGE_LOADS_TOP(numTopHits, "Pages Loaded By CyberTwin During Chat", "%", "URL"), tableSetTemplate3); %> <% PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(HITNODE_RULE_SETS(), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate3); PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(PROFILEVALUE_RULE_SETS(), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate3); /* PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(HITNODE_RULE_FOLDER_SET("4984", "%", "Label", "0"), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate1); PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(HITNODE_RULE_VALUESET("34 35 36 37 38", "Topics of Interest", "%", "Label"), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate1); */ %>

report.name: Technical
report.script:
<% var dateFrom = USERDEF:2011-01-01; var dateTo = USERDEF:2011-02-01; var numTopHits = "1000000"; var topHitsNodeIdScope = "-2"; var globalFilterRules = ""; %> MyCyberTwin Report <% SET_REPORT_DETAILS(dateFrom, dateTo, globalFilterRules); var numChats = CHATSTATS_NUM_CHATS_TOTAL(); var numEngagingChats = CHATSTATS_NUM_CHATS_ENGAGING(); var numNonEngagingChats = CHATSTATS_NUM_CHATS_NONENGAGING(); var tableSetTemplate1 = "ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[XAXISLABEL][YAXISLABEL]
[LABEL][VALUE]
"; var tableSetGraphTemplate1 = "

[XAXISLABEL][YAXISLABEL]
[LABEL][VALUE]
"; var tableSetTemplate2 = "ROWS{}

[VALUE][LABEL]

[VALUE][LABEL]

"; var tableSetGraphTemplate4 = "
ROWS{}
[TITLE]
[YAXISLABEL][XAXISLABEL]
[VALUE_PERC][LABEL]
"; %>

MyCyberTwin Report for [ORG_NAME]'s [CYBERTWIN_NAME]
Period - From: <% PRINT(dateFrom); %>     To: <% PRINT(dateTo); %>

Engagement
<% var chatVolumeSet = VALUE_SET("Chat Volume", "#", "Measurement", numChats, "1", "Total Chats", numEngagingChats, "1", "Engaging Chats", numNonEngagingChats, "1", "NonEngaging Chats"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(chatVolumeSet, tableSetTemplate1); var timeChatsSet = VALUE_SET( "Chat Time", "#", "Measurement", CHATSTATS_TIME_AVG(), "1", "Avg minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_MIN(), "1", "Min minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_MAX(), "1", "Max minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_MEDIAN(), "1", "Median minutes", CHATSTATS_TIME_TOTAL(), "1", "Total minutes"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(timeChatsSet, tableSetTemplate1); PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(CHATSTATS_TIME_SPREAD("","%","Measurement"), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate3); var msgChatsSet = VALUE_SET( "Chat Messages", "#", "Measurement", CHATSTATS_MSG_AVG(), "1", "Avg messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_MIN(), "1", "Min messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_MAX(), "1", "Max messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_MEDIAN(), "1", "Median messages", CHATSTATS_MSG_TOTAL(), "1", "Total messages"); PRINT_TEMPLATE(msgChatsSet, tableSetTemplate1); PRINT_GRAPH_TEMPLATE(CHATSTATS_MSG_SPREAD("","%","Measurement"), "BAR", "300", "300", tableSetGraphTemplate3); %>
KPIs
Overall Accuracy<%PRINT_NUMBER(ACCURACY_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
Direct Match Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(DIRECT_MATCH_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
Direct Default Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(DIRECT_DEFAULT_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Match Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_MATCH_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
AutoLearn Default Rate<%PRINT_NUMBER(AUTOLEARN_DEFAULT_RATE(),"##.#%");%>
Input Node Stats
<% PRINT(INPUT_NODE_STATS(topHitsNodeIdScope, numTopHits)); %>
